alert.note: Alert for Dunn; Pepin (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 9:28PM CDT until April 19 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Chippewa River at Durand affecting Pepin, Dunn and Buffalo Counties. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt upstream snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chippewa River at Durand. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, Highway 10 on the north approach to the bridge across the Chippewa River may flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 PM CDT Wednesday, the stage was 14.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 800 PM CDT Wednesday was 14.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.5 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.6 feet on 04/19/1982. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
